articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli forces bombarded cities, towns and refugee camps across Gaza overnight and into Thursday, killing dozens of people in an air and ground offensive against Hamas that has widened to most of the territory and forced thousands more to flee from homes and shelters.
articles.title: Israeli strikes across Gaza kill dozens of Palestinians, even in largely emptied north

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: RAMAT GAN, Israel (AP) — Igor Tudoran spent just 12 hours inside the Gaza Strip before a missile slammed into his tank, leaving him with a life-altering injury.
articles.title: The number of wounded Israeli soldiers is mounting, representing a hidden cost of war

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB and ILLIA NOVIKOV
articles.description: MYKOLAIV, Ukraine (AP) — They recognized the TV repairman. The residents of Oleshky in Russian-occupied southern Ukraine could not identify many of those they buried after a catastrophic dam collapse in June sent water coursing through their homes and shattered their lives.
articles.title: AP concludes at least hundreds died in floods after Ukraine dam collapse, far more than Russia said

articles.author: MEG KINNARD
articles.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley was asked Wednesday by a New Hampshire voter about the reason for the Civil War, and she didn’t mention slavery in her response — leading the voter to say he was “astonished” by her omission.
articles.title: Nikki Haley, asked what caused the Civil War, leaves out slavery. It's not the first time

articles.author: ACACIA CORONADO
articles.description: EAGLE PASS, Texas (AP) — Before settling in New York City like thousands of other migrants this year, Abdoul, a 32-year-old from West Africa, took an unexpected detour: Weeks in a remote Texas jail on local trespassing charges after crossing the U.S.-Mexico border.
articles.title: Texas has arrested thousands on trespassing charges at the border. Illegal crossings are still high

articles.author: VALERIE GONZALEZ
articles.description: MATAMOROS, Mexico (AP) — A ragged migrant tent camp next to the Rio Grande in Matamoros, Mexico, is a long way from the country's National Palace, where a top level U.S. delegation met with Mexico's president seeking more action to curb the surge of migrants reaching the U.S.
articles.title: Mexican officials clear border tent camp as US pressure mounts to stem migrant influx

articles.author: JEAN-YVES KAMALE and MARIA CHENG
articles.description: KINSHASA, Congo (AP) — As Congo copes with its biggest outbreak of mpox, scientists warn discrimination against gay and bisexual men on the continent could make it worse. In November, the World Health Organization reported that mpox, also known as monkeypox, was being spread via sex in Congo for the first time.
articles.title: Stigma against gay men could worsen Congo's biggest mpox outbreak, scientists warn

articles.author: HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH
articles.description: Gypsy Rose Blanchard, the Missouri woman who persuaded an online boyfriend to kill her mother after she had forced her to pretend for years that she was suffering from leukemia, muscular dystrophy and other serious illnesses, is set to be paroled on Thursday.
articles.title: Gypsy Rose Blanchard set to be paroled years after persuading boyfriend to kill her abusive mother

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. on Wednesday announced what officials say could be the final package of military aid to Ukraine unless Congress approves supplemental funding legislation that is stalled on Capitol Hill.
articles.title: US announces new weapons package for Ukraine, as funds dwindle and Congress is stalled on aid bill

articles.author: NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: DENVER (AP) — The Colorado Republican Party on Wednesday appealed that state's supreme court decision that found former President Donald Trump is ineligible for the presidency, the potential first step to a showdown at the nation's highest court over the meaning of a 155-year-old constitutional provision that bans from office those who “engaged in insurrection.”
articles.title: Trump ballot ban appealed to US Supreme Court by Colorado Republican Party
